alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:16PM HST until January 12 at 8:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR HALEAKALA SUMMIT... .A fast-moving cold front will bring freezing rain to the Summit and upper slopes of Haleakala tonight and early Friday morning. The front will move quickly east of Maui by Friday afternoon, and the chance for rainfall will diminish as temperatures gradually warm. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Total ice accumulations of around two to three tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions are possible due to ice accumulating on roadways.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
